# 3300_Lab0

In this lab we learned to create a simple 1 bit 2 by 1 multiplexer, and from that implement this multiplexer to simulate 3 bit **2 by 1** and **4 by 1** multiplexers. 

In these file the simple 1 bit *2 by 1 mux* is shown in the file labeled
>mux_2x1

The 3 bit *2 by 1 mux* is shown in the file labeled
>mux_2x1_3bit

Sketches used to derive my verilog code for the 3 bit 2x1 mux was the following
![3 bit 2x1 mux sketch](https://attachments.office.net/owa/ejpiche%40cpp.edu/service.svc/s/GetAttachmentThumbnail?id=AAMkAGM0ZDZmNGQ0LTFhYjctNGU4Ni1iYzhiLTQwM2U1MjJjYTkzYQBGAAAAAABDImjsBjZpSbakK1PfrPeOBwAQ7VoJLsqlSp6qc6tehrm4AAAAAAEMAAAQ7VoJLsqlSp6qc6tehrm4AAOI70sBAAABEgAQAKnnxwJe%2BgpGn7CjmgySGqE%3D&thumbnailType=2&token=eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsImtpZCI6IkU1RDJGMEY4REE5M0I2NzA5QzQzQTlFOEE2MTQzQzAzRDYyRjlBODAiLCJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJ4NXQiOiI1ZEx3LU5xVHRuQ2NRNm5vcGhROEE5WXZtb0EifQ..t3-uTqbvtNF-4nYOztm-3gmjSbznYHx--_f8BSY_vP8symXTu0oW2U56VpRpIZ57jUOvzG1Ev2zD1z0SnyZoYUbu4yvegyRA9vjZdb2PdWGRdxvw0XnlYavUsokhHZlzPIZk7ZxOq1meStCDC7N9tesiCzrnL_UsMdB2eGdzT7FqLZedVZLqzSegJCP5DMSivo9gRV8swscPrbNp82FhL7iCbmQ3Ntg8fy0y2PlvqmDI4YFS7XtSlXqnlktXPH2CMO6sTItyO72o60LH2_yLwyZJE59BQsoRmC1fso2wV9hJDeiVH50VnA20lpTgA08SE2oB1yH-x-GBP0wpee3w3g&X-OWA-CANARY=-OP__xjXTUmTufCYi5nj8ZCdgK0WItwY2se_H76awrhUff_2kPMBNxaf_g_b-Te6vqRrmXihtWs.&owa=outlook.office365.com&scriptVer=20240119003.13&clientId=39FD525F25D2409589243E1958126036&animation=true)

And the 3 bit *4 by 1 mux* is shown in the file labeled
>mux_4x1_3bit
